intro: Corydalis martini, commonly known as the Alpine Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
